item.title: today! 4p! come tell gov. polis to treat jails and prisons like...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

today! 4p! come tell gov. polis to treat jails and prisons like the public health crises they are, and to bring our incarcerated neighbors home. #CAAPV
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: Like the Ghosts of Christmas past, present, and future, CAAPV is...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Like the Ghosts of Christmas past, present, and future, CAAPV is going to visit the Governor tomorrow and ask that he bring our neighbors home. While he may have ended the death penalty, COVID-19 in prison is still a death sentence.

Please spread the word and join us in any way you can!

#CAAPV

Prisoners are being fed substandard meals — sometimes as little as two slices of bread, a piece of bologna, and an apple — and sometimes are not able to access showers for days at a tim…

item.title: #DYK: prisons and jails are a public health crisis. #CAAPV...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

#DYK: prisons and jails are a public health crisis.

#CAAPV urges you to act: tell gov. polis to treat "incarcerated people" with respect and dignity and to bring our neighbors home by joining ACLU of Colorado's effort here: https://action.aclu.org/send-message/co-covid-prisons…
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: "Every prisoner executed in 2020 either had a significant...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

"Every prisoner executed in 2020 either had a significant mental impairment (serious mental illness, brain damage or IQ in the intellectually disabled range, or chronic trauma) or was a teenager at the time of the crime. The year’s executions also highlighted numerous systemic problems in the application of the death penalty, including racial bias, the violation of Native American tribal sovereignty, disregarding the wishes of victims’ family members, ineffective representation, and inadequate appellate review."

https://deathpenaltyinfo.org/…/dpic-2020-year-end-report-de…

Death sentences reached their lowest level in the modern era and executions hit a generational low despite an historically anomalous federal execution spree, according to the 2020 Year End Report from the Death Penalty Information Center. At the same time, ignoring public health warnings and…

deathpenaltyinfo.org

DPIC 2020 Year End Report: Death Penalty Hits Historic Lows Despite Federal Execution Spree

Death sentences reached their lowest level in the modern era and executions hit a generational low despite an historically anomalous federal execution spree, according to the 2020 Year End Report from the Death Penalty Information Center. At the same time, ignoring public health warnings and…Death sentences reached their lowest level in the modern era and executions hit a generational low despite an historically anomalous federal execution spree, according to the 2020 Year End Report from the Death Penalty Information Center. At the same time, ignoring public health warnings and…

In June, Colorado passed SB217, one of the most thorough police accountability bills in the country. How it impacts the state remains to be seen.

5280.com

Colorado's Police Accountability Bill Is Historic. But Is It Enough?

In June, Colorado passed SB217, one of the most thorough police accountability bills in the country. How it impacts the state remains to be seen.In June, Colorado passed SB217, one of the most thorough police accountability bills in the country. How it impacts the state remains to be seen.

item.title: "One woman who is three months pregnant and being held for...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

"One woman who is three months pregnant and being held for a non-violent offense wrote, 'I was sleeping within a few feet of COVID positive inmates. Even though I tested negative and even though I am high risk because I am pregnant and have asthma the jail still did nothing to move me away from the people who tested positive.'"

Sheriff Elder received $15.6 million in federal funding for the specific purpose of COVID-19 protection... instead, he chose to spend the money on expensive projects like renovating the staff locker room and remodeling offices...and people in his jail sat without any defense against the deadly virus because he was PROHIBITING people from wearing masks in their housing units.

December 14, 2020 DENVER – As COVID-19 raged throughout Colorado jails and prisons, and more than 800 detainees at the El Paso County Jail tested positive for the virus, jail staff told incarcerated people begging for help: “we’re just going … Continue reading →

aclu-co.org

ACLU and Civil Rights Attorneys File Class Action Lawsuit Against El Paso County Sheriff for Deliberately Denying Masks and COVID-19 Protections to Incarcerated People | ACLU of Colorado

December 14, 2020 DENVER – As COVID-19 raged throughout Colorado jails and prisons, and more than 800 detainees at the El Paso County Jail tested positive for the virus, jail staff told incarcerated people begging for help: “we’re just going … Continue reading →December 14, 2020 DENVER – As COVID-19 raged throughout Colorado jails and prisons, and more than 800 detainees at the El Paso County Jail tested positive for the virus, jail staff told incarcerated people begging for help: “we’re just going … Continue reading →

sb-217 in action! #HoldCopsAccountable #CAAPV

https://www.cpr.org/…/lying-officers-first-to-lose-police…/…

A 2019 law ensures that officers who lie in court or during an investigation can not just move to a job at another police department.

cpr.org

Lying Officers First To Lose Police Certifications Under New Colorado Law

A 2019 law ensures that officers who lie in court or during an investigation can not just move to a job at another police department.A 2019 law ensures that officers who lie in court or during an investigation can not just move to a job at another police department.

item.title: ‼️ big announcement ‼️ #CAAPV has a website! wondering...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

‼️ big announcement ‼️

#CAAPV has a website! wondering who we are? what we’re up to? looking for resources? check us out ⬇️⬇️⬇️ and stay tuned for more updates!

www.caapv.org

Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence witness first hand the inequities experienced by black and brown people caught within the criminal justice system. CAAPV formed to do something more, to pursue more than incremental reform, to demand actual community justice.

caapv.org

Home | Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence
